name: Real Horror Stories Ultimate Edition
description: Urban myths are stories that may or may not have been believed to be true. Unlike most, some are actually based on real events. One of them, takes place in a haunted forest, near a cemetery, on the borders of a city, near you.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP/Vista Processor: Any Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Any DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 120 MB available space Sound Card: Any
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8 Processor: Dual-core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: This game is giving me nightmares, not from the screamers and loud sounds OR THE O P GRAPHICS but its the mere thought of 'A flash game on steam?'  10/10

So seriously, I have not been spooked more in all of my life as I know it, no joke. It was REALLY scary. This game has been a very enjoyable thrill-vill ride of chaos, suspension, and candle-lighting. None in all my gaming career have I ever been faced with such challenging and promising puzzles. I think I can sleep easy now knowing that games like this exist purely to give us that special butterfly feeling in our tummys. Truly a standard the gaming industry should partake in. Why would you want to ever do micro-transactions like in Dead Space 3, when instead you can enjoy a good old-fashioned spooky transaction. Countries should learn a thing or two about this kind new currency that is currently only available in the pure spook of Real Horror Stories.™  This is a story about a man who is haunted by the visions of his dead daughter, boy, mother, and wife. It is revealed in the later-plot that they were killed by asphyixation, and dumped in the well by the protagonist. In response to the protagonist's evil doings, the massacred family strike a deal with the spirits of the forest, and, using their combined power, created a mystical labyrinth to test the protagonist. (Who we learn name's is Belial.) The spirits and the family design the rough, ardous challenges of tracing your cursor (Which we later learn is a satan conjuring wand.) through a difficult, poor-hitboxed maze made on purpose to test the protagonist's frustration of the hatred for his family. When the story finally comes to a climax, you must finish what you started by defeating Pudge, (From Dota 2) who frequently appears on your screen, and returning your wife to her watery grave. Then, you are left with a choice. The guru of stone is finally able to reach you, and presents you with both his hands.  This final epic climax demonstrates the deep moral choices of the protagonist. He must chose between his left hand, (the will of the few, since most people use their mouse (Satan Conjuring Wand) with their right hand.) and the right hand. (the will of the Protagonist, since most players would use their mouse (Satan Conjuring Wand) with their right hand.) If the Protagonist choses the left hand, he is released from his prison, and his family and the spirits are sealed in the well. If he choses the right, he choses his own selfish desires, and is doomed to endless fire and brimstone.   Endless Replay Value 10/10
Truely a spooky game. I met Mr. Skeltal and had to change my pants several times.
This game makes me p my pants. Then I cry.

Nice game, the trading cards are the best thing because you get more money out of it than you've paid. The game works fine too, I like the uninstall feature - the only feature that actually works.  10/10 would uninstall again I rate 69/420
I Love this game, it is pretty much the best game ever, it has: no storyline, broken gameplay, boring 'jumpscares' and stupid puzzles. 10 out of 10 in developer ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ness.

Literally the greatest game I've ever played. So many spooks to be had, better than any horror movie/game you ever played. Deserving of all titles declaring it the 'game of the year'. Ignore the April 1st, this game needs to be played to truly experience the SPOOKY SPOOKS of the game.

I really love this kind of horror game in which all i have to do is clicking and clicking on certain objects till the jump scares appear and process to the next part. The atmosphere is creepy and the sound effects are really sometime freak me out! But in fact some jump scares are so childish and make me laugh, also reduced the horror of the game sometime. Finnally, good horror game for 20 cents !
very nice game

I played the entire game, from start til end, even completed BOTH endings. I got this game as a gift, it was 40 cents, I was like I like trying shitay games, let's go! I start the loud game and realise there are no options, great start to a ♥♥♥♥ game. I start the game and realise i might go deaf, it might me worth it. I get the first jumpscare and then it is like, just a shmat badly photoshoped .jpeg picture. I see that that is all the game is, bad photoshopping. I hate my life.  I love bad games.   (Not this one)

I have to say, I am not one for horror games like this. To many jump scares. But forcing myself into ignor mode allowed me to get through this point and click style horror game. I have to say it was not bad. A little confusing at time on what to do. With the puzzles but still alright to play. Its worth picking up for something to add to your horror style play list.

I got it on sale for 29 cents. I expect so much quality and story for a game when paying 29 cents...  Really though it reminded me of one of those carnival haunted house rides that has the rickedy old cars. That being said the game has no replay value because once your through one of those rides you know where all the thing that jump out already are.  If it is on sale for 29-50 cents i would get it.

It's an alright game, 6/10.

I like to heer story from my parents. I was a orphan and was taken into hostage by my fosters. In their haus many of the urban legends were thrue told in this game. I connected right into to the game and had feeling i had inside my head as a child in my foster home. Hope this whelps everyones opinion to buyu the game. I holehearteadly recomend this game to mystery and horror urban legends fans who seek excrement.
This game is trully terrifying, it was capable of causing me to simaeltaneously ejaculate and deficate my bowels in one swift movement. 10/10 Game of the year.

all i can say is i was dissapointed with lack of skeletons but otherwise this game would make great toilet paper if it were a physical object you could buy and own and hold in your hands (but you can't)
Buy it when its on sale and have a laugh of it :P (i got it when it was 19 cents)
It's nice and Scary little bit.
Me and some friends played this game at 4am it was horribly fun (lel)  9/11 Masterpiece  This game had no logic 17/10 it's ok
If this game was a potato, It would be a bad potato
Real Horror Stories is a Real horribly bad Game filled with bad point a click design and cover with cheap uneffective Scares.  0/10 Verdict: Unacceptable  What is Scary is that it got Greenlighted

Serious review below (because joke reviews are not useful, but a waste of time):  This is a supposedly enhanced version of a free web game, with more puzzles, better graphics than the original version and a clue system, that helps you if you are stuck for a very long time in one the game's levels. Want to demo the game on your browser? Try using google and you'll find it. The idea behind it is nice, but it is badly executed. Lack of clues to solve puzzles, one annoying puzzle that forces you to have great mouse control with lots of trial and error, a puzzle that requires you to memorize a word from a large text, etc.  The game's sounds are good, but become very repetitive if you take too long to finish a room. There are some very weird and disgusting scenarios that fit the game well. The jump scares can frighten some people, but they are overused and predictable, with a B-horror, funny effect.  I bought this because of the huge discount (75%) and because the game gives you cards, so I ended up paying a negligible price for the game after selling the 3 cards it gave me.  Unless you want this game's cards, stick to the free version, which never got some annoying endgame puzzles.

When i started this game at first time, it was quite promising, after 3 minutes it turned out i misunderstood something. I can't see the stories during the progress, there are cool looking evil occult worship themes here, with bloody, unholy visions, but the puzzles ruins the entire game. Probably the most senseless ones i've ever seen in this genre, and they feel like unfinished, or just bugged. Devs should have been sit on this product much longer. Quite gross.
The puzzle ♥♥♥♥ing resets when you ACCIDENTALLY click off it...

This game... Oh, where to start? Maybe with the fact that it's complete crap? Ooh, no. How about the cheesy 'jumpscares' that would only scare 5 year olds? That would probably be the directed audience, if it weren't a point 'n' click game that makes you spend the whole time clicking all over the screen to find what you're looking for. You literally have no sense of whether or not it's clickable. The game is made in Flash, and usually goes on sale for unsuspecting people who are either very curious, have 20 cents, or just don't read reviews. Well, if you're reading this, don't buy the game unless ♥♥♥♥♥♥ point 'n' clicks are what you're into. This is literally the only game that I would give a 1/10 rating to.

Welcome to the wild and wacky world of 'Real Horror Stories Ultimate Edition', AKA 'Cheap And Nasty Jump Scares And Insanely Illogical Puzzles: The Game'.    It's cheap...ooh, it's cheap. And it actually does manage to scare, if you turn off all the lights, put on some headphones, turn the volume up real loud and don't tire too easily of some spooky face zooming suddenly up at you from the middle of the screen approximately every 2.5 minutes of gameplay (something which does admittedly seem to work on yours truly again and again and again, but then again, I honestly do believe one of the scariest moments in cinema history is that shot in the Exorcist of the guy with the painted face suddenly bursting onto screen...so I may be somewhat biased here). And the puzzles...oh, the puzzles...I especially loved the one where you have to write 'Belial' in the tiled letters of a floor...everyone knows who Belial is, right? I personally just thought it was the ugly little round thing from Basket Case, but apparently he's also a world-famous demon...I really do need to read my bible more, apparently...   Which brings me to the next, er, curious point about this game. If you read the Steam Store page, you'll be under the impression this is a game about 'urban myths', and it does manage to keep up that particular thematic, more-or-less (possibly less, but let's not be pedantic), for at least the first quarter or so of 'gameplay' (note the inverted commas; they're not entirely accidental). But by the end we're seeing Popes on crosses in fiery barren landscapes, coaxing blood through lines carved into ancient Egyptian doors, and stabbing babies on altars just to see where the blood dribbles down to so we can solve the next puzzle. All 'urban myths', apparently. I don't know about you, but nothing cries out 'urban' more loudly to me than Egyptian tombs and desert landscapes.   In all seriousness, this is a rival for the 'worst' game I've ever played. Having said that, I still managed to enjoy it much, much more than many other games which are undeniably more aesthetically accomplished, not least of all on account of its stupidly short playing time and the generosity of the game-makers themselves in including a 'hints' section which all but tells you exactly what to do. AND it only cost me twenty cents, on super-sale. If it ever gets down to that low, low price ever again, I'd actually recommend you buy it. It does have some really nice imagery, which you can make some pretty groovy screenshots out of. The only downside to this is, in order to get said screenshots, you may actually have to play the game.  Verdict: 4/10 (for the pretty pictures and spooky sounds).
An obvious masterpiece. A hidden gem that fell through the cracks when it deserved more recognition. Just kidding it's ♥♥♥♥.

Got it for like $0.16 from a friend. This game had a great and startling beginning, then develed into satanic garbage, which is not exactly horror.  The puzzles are weird, they don't give you clear objective as to how to beat them or what to do. The game went from scary to lame the moment it went to the grave-pentagram puzzle.  This game in my opinion is so bad I wouldn't even recommend it on sale.  Maybe if you're absolutely bored and it's free then go for it. But I wouldn't spend actual money on this.

Got it for like $0.16 from a friend. This game had a great and startling beginning, then develed into satanic garbage, which is not exactly horror. This game in my opinion is so bad I wouldn't even recommend it on sale.  Maybe if you're absolutely bored and it's free then go for it. But I wouldn't spend actual money on this.
The most generic, boring, and unscary 'horror' game i have ever played. No matter what the price is it's too much for this trash. Do not play
Complete trash. Absolute trash. A waste on every level. DO NOT BUY. The only horror was that I finished it. Also, crap payoff if you manage to bear through it.
Cons: -Cheesy/bad jumpscares -No plot -confusing puzzles (no logic to them) -animations are horrible  pros: -animations are hilarious -guest appearance by the pope  2/10

I don't really know what to say other than the only possible way to get scared of this game is wearing headphones on high so the loud noises can scare you. Even so, most of the jump scares were waaay to easy to anticipate. The name is really misleading :'C

For I paid so little money for it, I'm nearly ashamed to critisize, but nevertheless.....I feel the urge to. I gave up at Lvl 12 (even in a game I won't do sth like THAT! That what I obviously should have done to get further was not scary, but plain disgusting and sick!). I hoped for a tiny little adventure game with some atmosphere... Instead I was thrown into some random, not really connected sceneries that had to be 'mastered' by some few clicks (sometimes even clueless clicking did the trick...) and getting ahead was just too linear with extremely reduced possibilities.  Well, I got some cheap jumpscares out of it and if you are looking for only those and want to take any disgusting action you are forced to, you'll be satisfied and will be hapy about your bargain. But his thingy not only has no noticeable storyline(s) but IMHO also is - at least in Lvl 12, where I refused to take action and closed that game forever - just plain sick. :(  I'm free from religious 'no-no's and usually I love horror/creepy/scary adventures, but a game should be satisfying - like, e.g. those of Jonathan Boakes/darkling room <3 - but this game? Sorry. Nice background sketches (photos?), but sorry, no. Nope. Never again, although I usually don't like to judge a game before I got through the whole thing. But this was just too disgusting.

I don't really know what to say other than the only possible way to get scared of this game is wearing headphones on high so the loud noises can scare you. Even so, most of the jump scares were waaay to easy to anticipate. The name is really misleading :'C
11 out of 10  would bang  -IGN
That this calls itself a puzzle game is an insult to puzzle games everywhere.

This game has no real story line. The puzzles are just random clicking and not based on logic. The art gets progressiely worse as you go through the levels. The scares become formulaic after the first couple of levels.

This game plays like it was designed by Richard Ramirez. Although that may seem fitting, it also means the puzzles lack any sense of logic. Instead, it requires clicking random, often hidden, objects. Sometimes multiple times, sometimes with a specific pattern. No two are really the same, and there are no clues.  If you wait long enough, something is likely to glow red to indicate what you should be doing. However, if you should get stuck, Gameore provides a full walkthrough both on their website and in the game's directory.  I can't really recommend this game. For no other reason than the shear frustration and randomness of it. The overall game's amateurishness would be forgivable if the game had either reason or substance.  The downvotes are not so random.
The download was the scariest part.

I haven't played much of this game, but I can already say that it's not even worth the nineteen cents I got it for on sale at 90% off. This feels like it should be a Facebook horror game. But that's just a start.  Where should I begin on how much suck this game is?  The puzzles are horrible. Entirely horrible. There's really no mystery to this game, and you expect every corner. The quality is subpar overall. Poorly animated individuals in game. I'm not the kind of schmuck that prefers graphics over storyline, but come on! At least put some effort instead of moving joints you ♥♥♥♥! The scares are entirely forced and they are EXPECTED. There are so many things bad about this game that I don't even want to elaborate.  DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! It isn't worth your time or pocket change!  Besides, the only thing scary about this game is the amount of money it's selling for at poor quality.  It's like playing a Call of Duty game! All hype, no fulfillment!

This game calls itself Real Horror Stories.  And I believe it. In real life, I find myself poking things until they make a *slightly* different noise than before, and I get a jump-scare, usually in the form of police. Yep, that's Biggles' good ol' day-to-day.  The problem, you could say then, is that this game is TOO real. I don't want to be reminded of that time I played Simon Says to unlock a spooky door, or that time I hung out with a crucified Pope. Those were rough days!  Oh, or how about that time I could only progress by lighting an arbitrary pattern of candles? That Slayer concert didn't go well at ALL.  You see, this game, much like life, is a sequence of poorly-photoshopped flitered .png files. Occasionally, by which I mean literally twice, it does present a challenge with some logic and reasoning that you can sorta see if you squint hard enough and tilt your head and hold your breath nearly long enough to pass out. Too often though, the solution is simply to poke a random object MORE TIMES. While this happens more often in life than you'd think (ask your parents, kids), it's not exactly fun.  So, let's move onto word #2 of the title.  'Horror'. Horror, according to my handy pocket dictionary, means 'an intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust'. Wow. I was disgusted pretty intensely when I learned the corner shop near my abode sells those awesome lollipops with the bubble gum inside for $0.25, the price I paid for this game. Those were a crucial part of my childhood, and a big part of why I'm a blubbery bear today. And I could have had that nostalgia trip instead of this game. Consider me horrified.  Word #3: Stories  As far as I can tell, this game's overall branching narrative was to throw some dude my girlfriend affectionately called 'YARRRLL' based on the noise he makes down a well. I don't know what the devs have against YARRRLL, but he seemed like a cool guy to me.  Word #4: Ultimate  This sure was as ultimate as a game about clicking things in the hopes they'll throw me some progress if I promise to stop is ever gonna be.  Word #5: Edition  Yep, this was an edition of the aforementioned game.  So that's 2/5 categories in which I was satisfied. Not good enough in today's cutthroat gaming industry.  For my $0.25-   You know what?  My heart's not in this anymore.  It's just not good, as you all already expected.  Go home.  Leave Biggles to his sadness. Could've had that blubber pop.  *sigh*
The real horror is the lack of the $0.54 not on my steam account anymore
Jump-scare simulator, it's pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Literally all you do is push tab and enter until some cheap .png jump-scare pops up and you win.  i got this for 19 cents and that's really all it is worth

Even though this game has a very, let's be nice and call it, 'unique' graphic style that could have worked, it makes a bad mistake for a horrorgame. After every step of every 'puzzle' something jumps at the screen or makes a noise. Well the 'puzzles' are also not really puzzles, most of them make totally no sense and one audio-puzzle runs so bad you mostly have to guess your way through. All in all you can clear the game in less then one hour, if you are lucky and guess the puzzles right.  I would say, if you are someone who likes to 'jump' due to sudden stuff and are easy to be scared, put on your headphones and have your fun. If you are not easily scared skip it totally.

I got this game thinking it'll be a fairly simple point and click game with some jump scares and that's what I got except that you have to WAIT ALL THE TIME!!! You have to wait to click certain things, wait for the pathetic jump scares and wait again after you have clicked just to click the next in the sequence. I've played this game for half an hour and for most of that time I was sitting, shouting at the screen to hurry the f*** up!!!!! There doesn't seem to be any kind of story or plot to follow it's just random 'scary' scenes that you waste time on waiting for something to glow so you can continue on since clicking the area before it glows does nothing at all! The scars aren't scary, the jump scares are predictable and you spend most of the game shouting at it to hurry up. I bought this game while it was on offer and I was STILL ROBBED!!! Very dissapointed with this poorly designed game. It sounded so promising.......

Wow, what a game. From the challange puzzels to the horrendus Jump scares to sp00k you. from what i can say this game is the new bad rats and and should only be sent as a troll gift at a sale of 85% off or more.  Rutabaga/10 Never again.

Wow, what a game. From the challange puzzels to the horrendus Jump scares to sp00k you. from what i can say this game is the new bad rats and and should only be sent as a troll gift at a sale of 85% off or more.  Rutabaga/10 Never again.
It's horrible and with horrible I mean the game.
This game is total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I almost fell asleep while ''playing'' this. TOTAL. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T
Load of rubbish, can tell why it was on sale for £0.15. I now want the 10 minutes of my life that I spent playing this, returned to me in full.

What a horrible game. Not evben worth the 39 cents I paid for it. Tried way to hard to be spooky with the jump scares and had a pointless, directionless story line. It took multiple clicks on everything to make anything happen. I eventually got stick clicking on these two kids graves over and over, and I could never figure out what the Hell I was supposed to do. Screw this game.

Not sure about recommending this game. Nothing special about the graphics. The sound effects are ok and there are some cheap thrills, but once you have seen what the game is about, those thrills and sounds lose their effect quickly. Mostly just clicking until something happens, though sometimes there is a pattern. Fair game a best that took me 63 minutes to beat, so....up to you if you wanna spend the money, although cheap, on an hour long game.
A ♥♥♥♥♥♥ flash game
dis game be wiggy wack yo, ma boys done play it and all you be doing is clickin, eferyting, den nottin be happin fo like five minute son. I dun be recommend diss game fo no one aight
This is bad. Laughably bad. Don't buy it unless if you hate money.
This is literally a Newgrounds-tier flash animation.

This is the worst game I've ever played and I've played plenty of cool point and click games. There is no strategy in the game, and the only thing slightly unique about it is the horror theme. I spent an hour clicking the screen waiting for 'scary' faces to pop up which just came out as annoying, not even scary at all. This is the biggest waste of $2 I've ever spent, find something worth your time.

Wish I read the reviews before paying, but I figured with such a low price tag, it wouldn't matter. Now I see that everyone can agree: it's a crappy game.   There were a few cool puzzles, like the 'five demons in a circle' and the newspaper jigsaw, but most levels don't make too much sense. I think I click on a dead body to hear its squishy sound for like five minutes before the level changed for me to click on anything else. And there's a lot of things like that- click on this dead body until flies, spiders, blood, or a ghost jumps at you. And then the level is over, and now there's another body to click on.  Jump scares. They're a tool which can be used to make the game scarier... if you really think the player is off his or her guard at that point in the game. Here, it's how the player knows he or she spam clicked a rotting corpse enough times. Not very scary at all. There are better free games out there, so don't bother.
Reminded me too much of The House 2, and at least that had plot.

The whole gameplay consists of random clicking on static oh-so-scary images, activating random effects and releasing BOO! jumpscares in your face. Also there is one Simon Sez minigame and one extremely annoying Follow the Wire minigame. And that's it. Despite the name the game has absolutely no story. I can't be even angry at this game because it cost me only 20 cents and it's almost amusingly bad. The scary imagery is overblown so much it's completely ridiculous. The actions are so random that I've solved most puzzles just by clicking on everything without knowing what am I doing. Surprisingly such a simple game has some technical issues: Sometimes when I pressed ESC for the main menu it failed and just flashed from fullscreen to windowed and back. Also if you click too fast the same sound effects start playing over each other. I can hardly recommend this trash even for free. The only interesting thing about Real Horror Stories is: How the hell did it get on Steam?

Basically this is an extended version of a free flash game that can be found on the developers website. The version on sale here adds a few new puzzles but overall it's the same as the free version.   Gameplay consisters of clicking on objects in the enviorment until some happens (usually a jumpscare) that takes you to the next area. There are puzzles in the later stages of the game that may require a guide, but nothing too difficult. The game itself shouldn't take very long to complete. I beat it in less than half and hour.  I would not recommend this game unless you want something short and simple to film yourself reacting to for YouTube, and in that case I would recommend just play the free version.
no plot, very boring, just a bunch of half hearted jump scares.
Overall, looking back, I'd have to say it's the worst game I've ever played.  9/10

This is more like a movie with very little dialogue and action rather than an interactive game. I found I could not travel through this so called haunted forest I had to stay in the same spot /position and wait for events to come to me. Some of those events were scary some were not. I was then put in another scene again I could not travel forward I was stuck. Spoiler Alert I was forced to listen to an old woman cry in front of a swing. The only thing I could do was click on the swing and hear a child laugh. Again not scary just annoying.  I am disappointed in this game or should I simply refer to it as a very boring movie?
If you hate jump scares, you will hate this game. If you are impartial to jump scares, you will hate this game.   Nice ambiance, but that's about it.
Not that scarry, but a good way to pass the time solving riddles.
